accelerator.description: Supported types: nvidia, intel, amd, google

env.description: Environment variables specific to accelerator types
env.title: env

resources.description: Resource names for different accelerator types
resources.title: resources

accelerator.title: accelerator

acceleratorTypes.description: Only an option for LWS (multinode) subGroupExclusiveToplogy: true XPU-specific node affinity
acceleratorTypes.title: acceleratorTypes

containers.description: Name of the scheduler to use for scheduling decode pods (overrides global schedulerName) schedulerName: decode-scheduler

items.description: EnvVar represents an environment variable present in a Container.

name.description: Name of the environment variable. May consist of any printable ASCII characters except '='.

value.description: Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the previously defined environment variables in the container and any service environment variables. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. Double $$ are reduced to a single $, which allows for escaping the $(VAR_NAME) syntax: i.e. "$$(VAR_NAME)" will produce the string literal "$(VAR_NAME)". Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Defaults to "".

valueFrom.description: EnvVarSource represents a source for the value of an EnvVar.

configMapKeyRef.description: Selects a key from a ConfigMap.

name.description: Name of the referent. This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are almost certainly wrong. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

optional.description: Specify whether the ConfigMap or its key must be defined

fieldRef.description: ObjectFieldSelector selects an APIVersioned field of an object.

apiVersion.description: Version of the schema the FieldPath is written in terms of, defaults to "v1".

fieldPath.description: Path of the field to select in the specified API version.

fileKeyRef.description: FileKeySelector selects a key of the env file.

key.description: The key within the env file. An invalid key will prevent the pod from starting. The keys defined within a source may consist of any printable ASCII characters except '='. During Alpha stage of the EnvFiles feature gate, the key size is limited to 128 characters.

optional.description:
Specify whether the file or its key must be defined. If the file or key does not exist, then the env var is not published. If optional is set to true and the specified key does not exist, the environment variable will not be set in the Pod's containers.

If optional is set to false and the specified key does not exist, an error will be returned during Pod creation.

path.description: The path within the volume from which to select the file. Must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

volumeName.description: The name of the volume mount containing the env file.

resourceFieldRef.description: ResourceFieldSelector represents container resources (cpu, memory) and their output format

containerName.description: Container name: required for volumes, optional for env vars

secretKeyRef.description: SecretKeySelector selects a key of a Secret.

key.description: The key of the secret to select from.  Must be a valid secret key.

name.description: Name of the referent. This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are almost certainly wrong. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

optional.description: Specify whether the Secret or its key must be defined

modelCommand.description: vllmServe - modelservice will add the command vllm serve to the container   imageDefault - no command will be added; the default command defined in the image will be used   custom - use user provided "command"
modelCommand.title: modelCommand

mountModelVolume.description: when set, a volumeMount (and volume) is created for model storage
mountModelVolume.title: mountModelVolume

items.description: ContainerPort represents a network port in a single container.

containerPort.description: Number of port to expose on the pod's IP address. This must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536.

hostIP.description: What host IP to bind the external port to.

hostPort.description: Number of port to expose on the host. If specified, this must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536. If HostNetwork is specified, this must match ContainerPort. Most containers do not need this.

name.description: If specified, this must be an IANA_SVC_NAME and unique within the pod. Each named port in a pod must have a unique name. Name for the port that can be referred to by services.

protocol.description: Protocol for port. Must be UDP, TCP, or SCTP. Defaults to "TCP".

resources.description: ResourceRequirements describes the compute resource requirements.

claims.description:
Claims lists the names of resources, defined in spec.resourceClaims, that are used by this container.

This field depends on the DynamicResourceAllocation feature gate.

This field is immutable. It can only be set for containers.

items.description: ResourceClaim references one entry in PodSpec.ResourceClaims.

name.description: Name must match the name of one entry in pod.spec.resourceClaims of the Pod where this field is used. It makes that resource available inside a container.

request.description: Request is the name chosen for a request in the referenced claim. If empty, everything from the claim is made available, otherwise only the result of this request.

limits.description: Limits describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/

requests.description: Requests describes the minimum amount of compute resources required. If Requests is omitted for a container, it defaults to Limits if that is explicitly specified, otherwise to an implementation-defined value. Requests cannot exceed Limits. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/

containers.title: containers

annotations.description: Additional annotations to be added to the PodMonitor
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description: Create PodMonitor resource for decode deployment
enabled.title: enabled

interval.description: Interval at which metrics should be scraped
interval.title: interval

labels.description: Timeout after which the scrape is ended scrapeTimeout: "10s" labels -- Additional labels to be added to the PodMonitor
labels.title: labels

metricRelabelings.description: MetricRelabelConfigs to apply to samples before ingestion
metricRelabelings.title: metricRelabelings

path.description: HTTP path to scrape metrics from
path.title: path

portName.description: Port name to scrape metrics from (must match container port name)
portName.title: portName

relabelings.description: RelabelConfigs to apply to samples before scraping
relabelings.title: relabelings

extraObjects.description: Extra objects to be deployed alongside the main application
extraObjects.title: extraObjects

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

modelArtifacts.description: Name of the scheduler to use for scheduling model pods schedulerName: default-scheduler

mountPath.description: authSecretName: location where model volume will be mounted (used when mountModelVolume: true)
mountPath.title: mountPath

size.description: size of volume to create to hold the model
size.title: size

uri.description: hf://model/name - model as defined on Hugging Face   pvc://pvc_name/path/to/model - model on existing persistant storage volume   oci:// not yet supported
uri.title: uri

modelArtifacts.title: modelArtifacts

multinode.description: When true, a LeaderWorkerSet is used instead of a Deployment
multinode.title: multinode

acceleratorTypes.description: Only an option for LWS (multinode) subGroupExclusiveToplogy: true XPU-specific node affinity
acceleratorTypes.title: acceleratorTypes

routing.description: also describes elements for Gateway API Inference Extension configuration

env.description: pluginsCustomConfig:   custom-plugins.yaml: |     apiVersion: inference.networking.x-k8s.io/v1alpha1     kind: EndpointPickerConfig     plugins:     - type: custom-scorer       parameters:         custom-threshold: 64     - type: max-score-picker     - type: single-profile-handler     schedulingProfiles:     - name: default       plugins:       - pluginRef: custom-scorer         weight: 1       - pluginRef: max-score-picker         weight: 1 @schema items:   $ref: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/yannh/kubernetes-json-schema/master/master/_definitions.json#/definitions/io.k8s.api.core.v1.EnvVar @schema

env.title: env

pluginsConfigFile.description: prefix-estimate-config.yaml, default-pd-config.yaml, or you may define a custom config below and select it with the pluginsConfigFile field.
pluginsConfigFile.title: pluginsConfigFile

matches.description: rules:   - backendRefs:       - group: inference.networking.x-k8s.io         kind: InferencePool         name: inference-pool-name         port: 8000         weight: 1     matches:       - path:           type: PathPrefix           value: / when specifiying matches and not rules, it will use the default backendRef block but overwrite just the matches section of a single rule
matches.title: matches

timeouts.description: They are set to 0s which in most situations defaults to the providers max timeout.
timeouts.title: timeouts

secure.description: Boolean: adds the `--secure-proxy` flag to the routingSidecar with your chosen value.  Arg is ommitted by default for compatability with legacy sidecar images.
secure.title: secure

targetPort.description: target port on which VLLM should listen
targetPort.title: targetPort

servicePort.description: modelName: random/modelId port the inference engine (VLLM) listens when a sidecar (proxy) is used it will listen on this port and forward to VLLM on proxy.targetPort
servicePort.title: servicePort

routing.title: routing
